Change global settings for the client.
Allows you to zoom in on distant objects.

Makes the surrounding environment brighter.
Allows you to see more clearly in The End, Nether, and at night.
A basic recreation of the Java Edition debug menu.
Allows you to sprint or sneak without holding the respective key.
Shows where the nearest chunk border is.

Changes the selected block outline/overlay.
The "Outline Selection" setting needs to be enabled in video settings.
Customise your crosshair to your hearts content.
Draws a bounding box around all entities.

Displays and stores coordinates of specific locations in the world.
To create a waypoint, type ".waypoint" in the Minecraft chat.
Shows a list of all players in the world.
Changes what color entities will be when hurt.
Displays the detonation time of TNT.
Displays the nearby areas where mobs are able to spawn.
Makes dropped items have unique physics.

Makes your camera smooth, kinda like
the effect your aim has with optifine zoom
Blurs movement to make you throw up suspiciously

Makes the surrounding area illuminate when
equipped with light-emitting items.
Home for customising colors in the client.
Displays a red vignette on the screen when you have low health.
Multiply the amount of critical hit particules.

Automatically say a message at the end of a game.
Works on Hive, CubeCraft, Zeqa, NetherGames, Hyperlands
Sends a custom message in the chat when your hotkey is pressed.
Change the size of your GUI.

Makes the second skin layer 3D.
Due to how the mod works, this will not work with players who have 128x skins or custom geometries (4D Skins).

Makes the items appear as if they were 2d like the old bedrock.
Note that the items are still 3d so you dont save performance.

Disables the screen shake when view bobbing is enabled.
(Requires view bobbing to be enabled.)

Allows you to look at your surroundings
without changing movement direction.

Makes you look back (third person camera front)
while the key is pressed

Basic tools to help you work faster.
Only use with permission if you are on someone else's world/server!
Allows you to fine-tune your click settings.

Proximity Chat!
Allows you to use Mumble Link via the Onix Client Mumble Link application.
Modifies keybind handling when exiting screens to act like Java 1.12+.
Displays the IP of the server you are playing on.
Shows what direction you are looking at in degrees.
Displays the reach of your last hit. Not 100% accurate due to latency!
Shows the amount of hits you do on an enemy without getting hit.
Displays the name and description of your texture packs on screen.
Shows the armor and mainhand item you have equipped.

Allows you to move and scale the paperdoll.
Paperdoll must be enabled in video settings.
Shows your current status effects and their duration.
Displays how many instant health potions you have in your life right now.
Displays how many arrow you have in your inventory.

Shows the surrounding audio that's played in the world.
E.g. lava pops, zombie growls, etc.

Shows the amount of day or playtime.
Note: This uses world time so /time or /alwaysday will break it.
Allows you to move and customise the scoreboard.
Shows your ping to the server
Allows you to move and customise the chat.
A Flappy Bird clone that you can play in Minecraft!
A Snake clone that you can play in Minecraft!
